talk.author: did:plc:r6kup4kaq5piyryt53q7djkk
talk.utter: We have a lot of good arguments against utilitarianism. But can definitely relate to this.

talk.author: did:plc:3b6d4szr6w3t5gk4ycy6o2wq
talk.utter: Glad you’re feeling me, Ramblin’ Rebels (not sure if that is name but I’d go with)

talk.author: did:plc:r6kup4kaq5piyryt53q7djkk
talk.utter: Typically we say Rebel Debate but I really love this idea!

talk.author: did:plc:r6kup4kaq5piyryt53q7djkk
talk.utter: Typically we say Rebel Debate but I really love this idea!

talk.author: did:plc:3b6d4szr6w3t5gk4ycy6o2wq
talk.utter: Well, talk it over. Also, when in doubt, little trick I saw was pulling out a mortality angle, no not morality,  mortality, people should live. Kid got me on that once, had to chew on and like taste of more than just more raw utilitarianism.

talk.author: did:plc:r6kup4kaq5piyryt53q7djkk
talk.utter: You answer that by asking who gets to live. Do you sacrifice groups of people to ensure other larger groups live? That's the kind of decision that historically leads to some bad oppressions. I don't have to cite a specific example cuz I'm sure you can come up with a few.
